reviews.review_msg: Although Courtney is now gone, CMNS 324 was by far the best class I have taken, and I feel very bad for those who did not get the chance to take it. AMAZING and RELEVANT and INTERESTING and EASY. Does not get any better than that.

first of all, this class is amazing, do not graduate without taking this course. Courtney was very inspiring, good lecture material, midterm was fair, the essay proposal was marked kind of hard, same goes with the op-ed assignment, guess that depends on your TA.
Great course if you want to listen to rambling life stories on a weekly basis! Although I did not mind coming to class, I did not enjoy his unconventional teaching style.

Excellent lecturer. I look forward to going to lec every week. Difficult to take notes because his teaching style is very story-orientated. Its a pleasure to listen to him talk about what he is obviously passionate about.

Rick is an awesome prof when it comes be being passionate about hat he's teaching about. He does tend to stick with one topic forever. If you are taking this class to talk sports, DON'T its a painful class for people who want to talk current sports. But its cool if you can put that aside and you learn alot sports media history and society

Very busy and hard to get hold of sometimes, and he jumps around a lot in lectures. But, he teaches with a passion that is just amazing. Brilliant, and often hilarious. If there is more entertaining lecturer at SFU I don't know who it is.

THE best lecturer, even if he does skip around a bit much...lots of good anecdotes, very conversational, easy to listen to...seems gruff, but is willing to help you out if you do your background work. Take anything with him, especially if you like sports.
He has a very good lecturing style.  He's funny and informative at the same time.  If you want to enjoy your lectures, take one of his classes.
Unreal lecturer, but so busy he can be hard to get a hold of outside of class. Great attitude and really knows his stuff.

Honestly, hard to stay awake while she lectures. Very disorganized course due to dividing the course with Danielle Deaveau. Overall, Sara is more friendlier and less of a marking dictator then Danielle. Expect her to laugh at almost everything.
